summary: In this context, urea is mentioned in relation to the noninvasive 13C-urea breath test (UBT), which is utilized for the detection of Helicobacter pylori infection in children. The UBT leverages the metabolism of urea by H. pylori, making it a valuable diagnostic tool. The study compares this method with a new fecal antigen test, highlighting the relevance of urea in diagnosing H. pylori infections.
